entry.tran: 在（饮食中）掺入杂质;掺假
entry.def: If something such as food or drink is adulterated, someone has made its quality worse by adding water or cheaper products to it.

example.ex: The food had been adulterated to increase its weight...
example.tran: 食物被掺了杂质以增加分量。

example.ex: There is a regulation against adulterated cosmetics.
example.tran: 规定禁止出售假冒化妆品。

auth_sentence.content: So it is unlikely these adulterated supplements were the result of mistakes made by wild harvesters.
auth_sentence.res_content: So it is unlikely these adulterated supplements were the result of mistakes made by wild harvesters.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So it is unlikely these adulterated supplements were the result of mistakes made by wild harvesters.

auth_sentence.content: One problem is that Italian officials charged with detecting adulterated oil can, in theory, be held liable for their actions.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: One problem is that Italian officials charged with detecting adulterated oil can, in theory, be held liable for their actions.

auth_sentence.content: Saffron from some Asian suppliers may be adulterated with everything from turmeric to dyed poppy petals.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Saffron from some Asian suppliers may be adulterated with everything from turmeric to dyed poppy petals.
